snippet: Charles J. Hynes, the Brooklyn district attorney, must testify under oath about allegations of misconduct in his office, just weeks before the Democratic primary, a judge ruled.
abstract: Federal Judge Robert M Levy rules that Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes must testify under oath about allegations of misconduct in his office, just weeks before Democratic primary in which he is running for re-election; ruling comes in case of Jabar Collins, who has filed a civil rights lawsuit against Hynes's office and the New York Police Dept, seeking to prove widespread abuses that tainted other cases over a 20-year period.
lead_paragraph: Charles J. Hynes, the Brooklyn district attorney, must testify under oath about allegations of misconduct in his office, just weeks before the Democratic primary, a judge ruled.

headline.main: Brooklyn Prosecutor to Testify in Suit Against Him Amid Re-election Bid
headline.print_headline: District Attorney to Testify in a Misconduct Suit
